result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment & follow through with recommended treatment.

Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. Take all medications as prescribed. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.

Any other assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

9:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DEREK K CHRISTIE in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for DEREK K CHRISTIE. 
Amended information to be filed. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; however, court acquiesces to DAGP for 2 years and plea is not accepted at this time. 
Count 3, Without DA enhancer, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Count 4, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Remaining charges DRI.
